imdb.title: Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu
imdb.plot: Various people, especially two rising commanders, cope with a massive continual space conflict between two interstellar nations.

episodes.title: Premonition of the Storm
episodes.plot: Now betaken of his rival and occupied with desk work, Von Lohengramm thinks back to the beginning of his friendship with Von Reuenthal and Mittermeyer.

episodes.title: In the Distant Frontier
episodes.plot: In Iserlohn Fortress, Julian ponders on what to do next and the hard task to follow in Yang's footsteps.

episodes.title: Roses at the End of Summer
episodes.plot: After surviving an assassination attempt by a survivor of the Westerland Massacre, Von Lohengramm is gravely shook, reminded of his most scandalous deed, and seeks consolidation by Hildegard von Mariendorf.

episodes.title: Rumbling
episodes.plot: A memorial service in the former Alliance territory turns into a massacre, possibly due to a Terraist conspiracy. Von Reuenthal's position becomes more fragile.

episodes.title: Burgeoning
episodes.plot: Multiple parties seek to have Von Reuenthal betray Von Lohengramm. Vicious rumors about an assassination attempt unjustly undermine his position.

episodes.title: The Urvashi Incident
episodes.plot: While paying respect to the imperial casualties on the colony Urvashi, Von Lohengramm's party is ambushed.

episodes.title: In the Name of Pride
episodes.plot: Framed by Heydrich Lang for the assassination attempt, and unable to leave Heinessen, Von Reuenthal sees himself forced to rise up in rebellion against Von Lohengramm.

episodes.title: Rebellion Is a Hero's Privilege
episodes.plot: Knowing that it is the only way to prevent Von Lohengramm from commanding the fleet himself, Mittermeyer accepts his orders to go to battle against his best friend, Von Reuenthal.

episodes.title: The Two Great Ones Strike at Each Other!
episodes.plot: Mittermeyer and Von Reuenthal prepare for battle. The latter sends former Alliance officer Murai to Iserlohn fortress, trying to gain Julian's support.

episodes.title: Live by the Sword...
episodes.plot: The fleets of Von Reuenthal and Mittermeyer clash.

episodes.title: Die by the Sword
episodes.plot: Von Reuenthal is defeated by Mittermeyer and retreats heavily wounded to Heinessen.

episodes.title: Endless Requiem
episodes.plot: The dying Von Reuenthal returns to his office to finish his affairs.

episodes.title: Running Start Towards the Future
episodes.plot: The Empire returns to its business after the death of Von Reuenthal.

episodes.title: Long Live the Empress! (Hoff Kaiserin)
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm and Hildegard von Mariendorf announce their decision to get married.

episodes.title: Invitation to Rebellion
episodes.plot: As riots break out on Heinessen, Julian decides to declare war on the Empire, although trust in the Iserlohn Republic Government is waning.

episodes.title: A Challenge to Arms
episodes.plot: The Wahlen fleet launches a disastrous attack against Iserlohn Fortress. Von Lohengramm is too sick to intervene.

episodes.title: Cosmic Mosaic
episodes.plot: After the imperial defeat at Iserlohn, Oberstein is appointed to keep order in the former Alliance territories, a task he performs with ruthless efficiency.

episodes.title: For Peace, Via Bloodshed
episodes.plot: Unrest breaks out on Heinessen after Bittenfeld is placed under house arrest for assaulting Oberstein. Meanwhile, the latter forces the Iserlohn politicians to come out of hiding in order to bargain for taken hostages.

episodes.title: Planet of Confusion
episodes.plot: After a prison riot and a terrorist bombing, chaos erupts on Heinessen, forcing Von Lohengramm to intervene himself.

episodes.title: Stehibalm Schloss Burns
episodes.plot: While Terraist extremists attack the imperial residence on Fezzan, Hildegard gives birth to Von Lohengramm's son and heir.

episodes.title: The Crimson Star Road
episodes.plot: An escalated incident leads to the Imperial and Iserlohn fleets clashing. The battle is interrupted when emperor Von Lohengramm collapses.

episodes.title: Bloodthirsty Maiden (Brünnhilde)
episodes.plot: The imperial doctors reveal that Von Lohengramm is suffering from a rare and incurable disease. Iserlohn forces board the flag ship Brünnhilde, allowing Julian to meet with the emperor.

episodes.title: The Golden Lion Flag (Goldenlöwe) Loses Its Light
episodes.plot: As resistance is ebbing away, Julian discusses the future of the empire with the dying Von Lohengramm.

episodes.title: Dream: To See It to the End
episodes.plot: After extermination of the Terraist remnants, Von Lohengramm approves of constitutional reforms for his New Galactic Empire and dies, leaving the future to Hildegard, Julian, Mittermeyer, and their sons.

episodes.title: After the Ceremony, the Curtain Rises Again
episodes.plot: As Von Lohengramm celebrates his coronation and Yang commits himself to marriage, Julian unites with Admiral Von Merkatz to form a new resistance force.

episodes.title: To Earth
episodes.plot: A short documentary on the history of Earth from 2039 onward.

episodes.title: The Künmel Incident
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm is threatened to fall victim to a Terraist conspiracy.

episodes.title: Visitors
episodes.plot: The imperial officers are dealing with their own problems, while Julian and co. head to Earth.

episodes.title: Past, Present and Future
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm reviews the secrets of previous emperors, while Yang frustrates authorities by not acting suspicious at all.

episodes.title: The Magician Is Captured
episodes.plot: After admiral Von Merkatz succeeds in hijacking many former Alliance ships and their crews, Oberstein orders Yang to be taken prisoner, laying a political trap to increase imperial authority on Heinessen.

episodes.title: Invitation to an Opera
episodes.plot: Oberstein's plan works out, as the Rosenritter take Heinessen's Supreme Chairman hostage, demanding the release of Yang.

episodes.title: Blood Running Down the Stairs (Cascade)
episodes.plot: Tension rises in the subjugated Alliance.

episodes.title: Holy Land
episodes.plot: As Julian's undercover position on Terra becomes dire, the Empire invades the Church headquarters.

episodes.title: Holiday's End
episodes.plot: After the bombing of the Terraist headquarters, Julian decides to travel to Heinessen. Meanwhile, Oberstein is held back by the other commanders, allowing Yang to leave Heinessen and seek out Merkatz' rebellion.

episodes.title: Against All Flags
episodes.plot: Multiple factions try to get their hands on the rogue Yang.

episodes.title: Under the Golden Lion Flag (Goldenlöwe)
episodes.plot: Yang's Independence underlines the fragility of the current balance of power.

episodes.title: Twilight of the Gods (Ragnarok) Again
episodes.plot: In response to the turmoil on Heinessen, Von Lohengramm plans to execute a second 'Operation Ragnarök'.

episodes.title: To El Facil
episodes.plot: By lack of a better plan, Yang sets course to El Facil to help establish a new democratic government.

episodes.title: The Battle to Retake Iserlohn
episodes.plot: Julian reunites with Yang and is informed of the latter's plans to retake Iserlohn Fortress.

episodes.title: The Prodigal Sons Come Home
episodes.plot: Yang employs his trademark tactics to retake Iserlohn Fortress.

episodes.title: The Battle of Marr-Adetta Starzone (Part One)
episodes.plot: Admiral Bewcock gives his all in the Alliance Fleet's last stand against Von Lohengramm.

episodes.title: The Battle of Marr-Adetta Starzone (Part Two)
episodes.plot: The remnants of the Alliance Fleet are ultimately crushed by Von Lohengramm as the news of Iserlohn's loss arrives.

episodes.title: The Edict of the Winter Rose Garden
episodes.plot: After the final defeat of the Alliance Fleet, Von Lohengramm sets for Heinessen, where the Free Planets Alliance is definitively abolished.

episodes.title: The Long Road Ahead
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm, Yang and Rubinsky contemplate their next moves. Yang talks with Julian about democracy and militarism.

episodes.title: Rolling Thunder
episodes.plot: Von Reuenthal is arrested by the military police for his suspicious liaison with a former noblewoman.

episodes.title: Eve of the Festival
episodes.plot: A fire destroying most of Heinessenpolis may prove useful for the imperial forces. Meanwhile, Yang is preparing to defend Iserlohn Fortress against another invasion.

episodes.title: To the Windy Corridor
episodes.plot: Despite a terrorist attack injuring several high-ranking officials, Von Lohengramm and his staff continue their operation to retake Iserlohn Fortress.

episodes.title: Spring Storm
episodes.plot: Under pressure of the imperial fleet, the El Facil Revolutionary Government agrees to retreat from Iserlohn Fortress. Meanwhile, the remnants of the Terraist church may prove more of a threat than thought.

episodes.title: The Battle of the Corridor (Beginning): The Invincible and the Undefeated
episodes.plot: Yang once again creates a strategic advantage to make up for his smaller fleet.

episodes.title: The Battle of the Corridor (Middle): Kaleidoscope
episodes.plot: The continuation of the Battle of the Corridor, during which both sides are pushed to their limits.

episodes.title: The Battle of the Corridor (Ending): End of the Imperial Expedition
episodes.plot: By changing their tactics, the imperial forces succeed in taking advantage of their superior numbers, slowly pushing back Yang's fleet.

episodes.title: The Magician Doesn't Come Back
episodes.plot: Yang decides to accept Von Lohengramm's peace offer and leaves Iserhlohn Fortress, unaware that this will be his final journey.

episodes.title: After the Festival
episodes.plot: The mourning Iserlohn Fortress faces the treat of desertion, when vice-admiral Murai takes on a role of understated heroicness.

episodes.title: The Disappointing Triumphal Return
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm, weakened by his illness, reflects on Yang's death, and the fact that in terms of capabilities, he is now completely alone.

episodes.title: The Order for the Transfer of the Capital
episodes.plot: While Rubinsky, Oberstein and Lang are all busy behind the curtains, Von Lohengramm declares Fezzan the location of the new imperial capital.

episodes.title: New Government in August
episodes.plot: Governmental reforms take place in the former Alliance territory and the newly founded Iserlohn Republic, where Julian ponders on his duty to succeed Yang.

episodes.title: First Battle
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm institutes new welfare reformations and Julian gains his first experience as fighter pilot, while the independent Rubinsky makes a decision that will change the course of the war.

episodes.title: Portraits
episodes.plot: The backstories of Mittermeyer and Von Reuenthal are relayed. The empire conceives an ambitious plan to retake Iserlohn Fortress.

episodes.title: One Narrow Thread
episodes.plot: Rubinsky pulls the necessary strings to manipulate the outcome of the war, whereas the Allied government has plans of its own regarding Yang.

episodes.title: Lost Things
episodes.plot: Yang is forced to return to Heinessen for an inquiry without legal basis, while the Empire completes its super weapon and Phezzan is secretly moving its pawns.

episodes.title: Inquiry
episodes.plot: The corrupt Alliance government inquires Yang about the justification of his actions, while the Empire prepares for war.

episodes.title: War Without Weapons
episodes.plot: An imperial invasion proves a dilemma for the Alliance, since Yang is far from the frontier, being questioned by the government.

episodes.title: Fortress vs. Fortress
episodes.plot: A battle between two massive space stations ensues, as the Empire tries to retake Iserhlohn Fortress.

episodes.title: Return
episodes.plot: The conclusion of the battle of the fortresses, during which Julian gains the opportunity to show his own tactical capacities.

episodes.title: With determination and ambition
episodes.plot: The aftermath of the battle of the fortresses prompts Rubinsky to set in motion a plan that may cause the defeat of the Alliance.

episodes.title: Thunder
episodes.plot: A secret arrangement between the Fezzani and Von Lohengramm is made to increase the latter's power.

episodes.title: Abduction of the Young Emperor
episodes.plot: The abduction of the emperor is set up as casus belli for Von Lohengramm to invade the Free Planets Alliance.

episodes.title: The Arrow Is Released
episodes.plot: The kidnappers of the emperor establish a government in exile with support of the Alliance, leaving Von Lohengramm as de facto leader of the Empire.

episodes.title: Departure of One
episodes.plot: Julian is sent on a mission to Fezzan.

episodes.title: Julian's Journey/Humanity's Journey
episodes.plot: A short documentary on the history of the Empire and the Free Planets Alliance.

episodes.title: The Battle Named 'Twilight of the Gods'
episodes.plot: While Yang's troops are separated by the government, Von Lohengramm plans a devastating surprise attack.

episodes.title: Invitation to a Requiem
episodes.plot: Although Julian starts to grasp the Empire's true intentions, the Alliance council refuses to take action as Operation Ragnarök is about to begin.

episodes.title: The Gjellenhorn Sounds
episodes.plot: On the eve of the imperial invasion, Von Reuenthal's mock attack on Iserlohn Fortress proves a challenge.

episodes.title: Occupation of Phezzan
episodes.plot: With the occupation of the heretofore independent Fezzan, Von Lohengramm seeks to tilt the galactic balance of power in favor of the Empire for once and for all. Meanwhile, Julian is still undercover on the occupied colony.

episodes.title: Arrival of the Cold Wave
episodes.plot: The severely weakened Alliance desperately tries to prepare for the imminent imperial invasion.

episodes.title: The Ark Fleet of Admiral Yang
episodes.plot: Seeing how the station has lost its strategic value, Yang decides to evacuate Iserlohn Fortress.

episodes.title: Search for a Universe of Freedom
episodes.plot: Julian narrowly escapes Fezzan, while Von Lohengramm briefs his staff about the upcoming confrontation with the Alliance fleet.

episodes.title: Two-Headed Snake: Battle of Rantemario
episodes.plot: The Alliance fleet tries to minimize damage during the Battle of Rantemario, vastly outnumbered by the Imperial forces.

episodes.title: The Darkness Deepens
episodes.plot: Returning to Heinessen, Yang is promoted to fleet admiral and tasked to come up with a new defense strategy. Seeing how Von Lohengramm has fallen ill, the Allied forces may just stand a chance.

episodes.title: Consecutive Battles
episodes.plot: With clever guerrilla tactics, Yang achieves multiple consecutive victories, forcing the imperial forces to revise their strategy.

episodes.title: Death Match of Vermillion, Part 1
episodes.plot: The Empire and the Alliance prepare for the decisive battle.

episodes.title: Death Match of Vermillion: Part 2
episodes.plot: The continuation of the battle between Von Lohangramm and Yang, which will decide the fate of the Alliance.

episodes.title: Emergency Turn
episodes.plot: Before Yang can deliver the final blow against Von Lohengramm, he is informed of the Alliance's unconditional surrender to the Empire.

episodes.title: Long Live the Emperor!
episodes.plot: With the surrender of the Free Planets Alliance, Yang retires to a quiet life, whilst Von Lohengramm is crowned emperor of the known universe.

episodes.title: In the Eternal Night
episodes.plot: In the 150th year of the Great War, rising imperial commander Reinhard von Lohengramm prepares to obliterate the Alliance fleet, but fears he is opposed by the "Hero of El-Facil," the illustrious Yang Wen-li.

episodes.title: Battle at Astate
episodes.plot: Yang is forced into a leadership position, and goes head to head with Von Lohengramm. The Battle of Astate comes to an end.

episodes.title: Birth of 13th Fleet
episodes.plot: Received back home as a war hero, Yang is granted command over the newly formed 13th fleet, while finding himself entangled in the Alliance's political disputes.

episodes.title: Imperial Afterglow
episodes.plot: After his victory at Astarte, Von Lohengramm is promoted to imperial fleet admiral and reflects on the events in his youth that awakened his ambitions.

episodes.title: Kastrop Rebellion
episodes.plot: A rebelling imperial colony offers Kircheis the opportunity to prove himself as Von Lohengramm's second-in-command.

episodes.title: The Knights of the Rose
episodes.plot: While preparing his attack on Iserhlohn Fortress, Yang gains a powerful ally.

episodes.title: Iserhlohn Captured
episodes.plot: Yang displays his strategic brilliance in an ambitious attack on Iserhlohn Fortress.

episodes.title: Cool, Clear Cybernetic Eyes
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm accepts the services of the machiavellist Oberstein to aid him recapture Iserhlohn Fortress, and possibly overthrow the emperor.

episodes.title: Klopstock Incident
episodes.plot: A banished noble's dubious return to court coincides with the increasing friction between Von Lohengramm and the imperial nobility.

episodes.title: Jessica's War
episodes.plot: Amidst the political turmoil on Heinessen, an old flame tries to win Yang's support for the pacifist party.

episodes.title: Actress Exits
episodes.plot: The emperor's former mistress kidnaps Von Lohengramm's sister out of jealousy.

episodes.title: Attack on the Empire
episodes.plot: The internally divided Alliance prepares to invade the Empire.

episodes.title: When the Rain of Grief Comes
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm implements a scorched earth strategy to deplete the invading Alliance's resources, but the officer in command of the operation is troubled by his past.

episodes.title: Emancipation of the Frontier
episodes.plot: Forced to help the depleted locals, the Allied forces are halted in their invasion.

episodes.title: Battle at Starzone Amlitzer
episodes.plot: A devastating battle ensues when the imperial fleet counterattacks the Allied forces.

episodes.title: New Currents
episodes.plot: A new Allied government is installed after their failed invasion, while the empire is shaken by the death of the emperor.

episodes.title: Before the Storm
episodes.plot: A conspiracy is conceived to disrupt the Alliance internally, while the Empire is coping with the death of its monarch.

episodes.title: The Lippschadt Conspiracy
episodes.plot: Dissatisfied with Von Lohengramm's military and political dominance, the imperial nobles assemble and revolt against the new regime.

episodes.title: Yang's Fleet Mobilization
episodes.plot: While Von Lohengramm plans his attack on the nobility's base, a coup d'état on Heinessen forces Yang to take up arms and fight for democracy.

episodes.title: Bloodshed in Space
episodes.plot: The rogue nobility finds itself unable to defeat Von Lohengramm's forces.

episodes.title: Doria Starzone Encounter
episodes.plot: Yang confronts the fleet of the Alliance's military regime, while Jessica Edwards organizes a massive protest in the capital city.

episodes.title: Courage and Loyalty
episodes.plot: While battling Von Lohengramm, the imperial nobles find that their greatest enemy may be themselves.

episodes.title: Goldenbaum Fallen
episodes.plot: Torn between his honest friend Kircheis and the ruthless Oberstein, Von Lohengramm faces the greatest moral crisis of his life.

episodes.title: Victory for Whose Sake?
episodes.plot: Yang reveals the Empire's involvement in the Allience's coup d'état, to deliver the finishing blow against the military regime.

episodes.title: The Day Before Destiny
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm is forced to deal with the consequences of the Westerland Massacre.

episodes.title: Farewell, Distant Light
episodes.plot: Von Lohengramm finds himself to be all alone as he becomes de facto ruler of the empire.
